review_title: A fun step back to a simpler time
one_reviews_text: This is just a demo that was used to sell VR as a platform way back when the Rift was brand new. It's very simple, but fun as a time-warp back to when things weren't quite figured out yet. Crack open this time capsule and pretend you're seeing VR for the very first time on the floor of a trade show. As a game there isn't a lot of merit, but as an over-the-shoulder glance back it's a worthwhile experience.

I really enjoyed this.

Very solid and overall felt great.

Cool demo! I love especially love the physics. When I took my pistol and I tried to knock one of the roof handles it moved! The haptic feeback works perfectly as well. The attention to detail is perfect. Each shell has it's own collisions and simulations. I love the glass as well. If it gets shot the way it shatters and the fact that I can then move the individual shards with other objects is so satifsying. I have to get Robo Recall!

Very short but great game. I actually forgot it was in VR and started dodging bullets like in superhot (i prefer shooting than throwing them back). Overall the experience was fantastic, I would play this over and over again

review_title: A great introduction to VR shooters
one_reviews_text: This is basically a demo/advert for the amazing Robo Recall game. It's short and focuses more on introducing the player to VR shooters than really challenging them in any way. A great starter game to show your friends what VR shooters are about.
Good introduction for new VR players to learn how moving and shooting work.

Beside the fact that you gobble down 4 GB for few minutes of action; I did enjoy the experience. Aiming is decently accurate; I have yet to understand why in VR, developers think that a projectile parabolic movement happen in few meters instead than in hundreds of meters (go ask a sniper how to shoot long distances and account for curvature arcs). Beside aiming a bit off than what you would normally do; the game is entertaining and well done. This is fundamentally the barebone of Robo Recall; minus the movement. If you want to get RR, try this first and see if you like it.
Pretty fun game, goes into robo recall which is really fun.

For those who can't seem to get it to work, I might have the solution for you. If you can get in the game, but can't see anything through your Oculus, then this can fix your problem. If you have Teamviewer installed, close out of it. You do not have to uninstall, just close out of it. Try running the game again and it should work. Overall fun game, it's a demo for Roborecall

It will convert non-believers into the magical world of VR and the possibilities.

review_title: Best 'game' to demonstrate VR to noobs
one_reviews_text:
This game, man... Is an excellent illusion for inexperienced users. (Almost prefer it's gameplay to Robo Recall) I'm one of the nerds that has lots of people in his life that can barely work a TV remote, let alone go save the universe in VR. 2 controllers, a headset and all those pretty squirrels to stare and poke at. They'd starve and die on some digital rock.

Enter a seriously fun jolt of franetic energy... a short blast of feel good violence and you can't be killed in the game. That is the real magic right there. While your aunt tries to figure out, for the fifteenth time, how to catch a rocket, she doesn't have to die over and over and get all f*****' cranky and start the horse crap up. I can't listen to everyone whine about how they can't play video games, yet they want to stay in VR and play games. I just... can't.

And everyone gloriously makes it through this fun experience with a smile on thier face. Even your best friend that still can't figure out how to use Siri... yes, even that person can complete Bullet Train.

I'm grateful to the devs. ;)
I love this demo, I wish they would release a full game!
One of the first things I played in VR and so far one of the coolest.

Well guys, this is all how Robo Recall got it's gameplay. Originally launched as a concept by Epic Games(Gears of War) Robo Recall is the full version of this concept. Awesome, short VR experience made by Epic, and gave the best of everything in order to make Robo Recall, taking the best of this concept and rollingwith it. Excellent concept/game.

review_title: Wow, this could become a great game!
one_reviews_text: One of the best things in VR up to now. I look forward to play it!

Love everything else, but teleportation makes me furious. I will not buy any more VR games that are teleportation only. Smooth move must be an option!! Arizona Sunshine added it. Serious Sam added it. Obduction added it. (Also, smooth/comfort turn options. It's the new standard.)

This game is super fun to play, when I first got it I must've played it at least ten times over the course of the next day. The fixed teleportation spots make it easy to know where you're going, while teleporting you with the same rotation you had before helps reduce some nausea. The one downside I have to say is that it quits out after every run of the demo. I'd love to see a small menu with a "start over from beginning" option so you can go back to the start without having to go through Home again (especially if it let you skip past the tutorial) Other than that, great game! ^^

A precursor to Robo Recall.  Play Robo Recall instead.

review_title: Great Demo Can't Wait for more
one_reviews_text: This is what VR Should be, don't like teleport type games but this one was not to bad, its not too big of a area so why not make movement with analog stick? the game is great as far as graphics and interaction and cant wait to see more from the developer

review_title: A short demo - but great fun!
one_reviews_text: It's a short demo - but I've found myself going through it several times. It's really quite fun racing around, picking up different weapons, and throwing slow-motion bullets. I would highly recommend downloading it - its free after all!
Was working fine before, but recently try to play and it doesn't open, only black screen.

On the screen I can see the inside of a train car, and hear something ringing, but there's no movement, the rift is dark, controls totally dead.  I have to force end the app on the computer.  i7 with 16GB RAM and GTX980 I would've thought would run this apparently not.

I waited with this demo because I thought teleporting wouldn't work well and would be boring. Boy was I wrong. It completely blew me away. I felt no nausea at all - which I feel pretty fast - and it was the best experience so far. I can't wait for ROBO RECALL.
Most realistic game I ever played.

such a shame its so short...
i keep playing this over and over, love it!
cant wait for robo recall, hope they dont ruin it by trying to make it "funny and cute" to appeal to a wide audience...
I've played this demo more than most of my actual games!!!! Can't wait for Robo Recall
Good game for the entry level player of touch. However, the game crashed serveral times and need to enhance the stablility
wow this thing shows what VR realy can do. I mean the Graphics are suzpber, the feeling superb, the movement wow, and it makes fun, im so happy if i can get robo recall which is the full game to this

If this is anything similar to what we have to look forward to with Robo Recall, take my money now! This is fantastic! Although it is only a demo, it really shows off what true immersion and action in VR will feel like.
This is a very short (5 min?) demo. But the gunplay is awesome. Sort of has Matrix elements (slow down time, catch bullets)
If only more VR shooters were as polished as this.  I can't wait for Robo Recall!

Make no mistake, like any VR experience this is mostly good to play once and show off to other people.  Luckily it's both free and awesome, so there's pretty much no reason not to download it.  Extremely well put together, visually exciting and makes a convincing demo for Robo Recall so give it a try.

Graphics and environments are awesome, gameplay less so. The concept of grabbing bullets/rockets and shooting them back at the enemies seems implausible and frankly doesn't work as well as simply using a gun. Hope this strategy is rethought in Robo Recall.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xm_Wgp3ZdOQ
Bullet train had a baby, that baby was called Robo Recall. Enough said!
Perfect introduction to a VR shooter. Short but lots of fun

review_title: Only one issue with this game
one_reviews_text:
It is too short!  This is a really short demo but it it awesome. Remember that when you get off the train and teleport into the big room you do not have to stay there.   That room has many teleport locations.   Move around in the room and you will find a shotgun etc.    

One thing you can do that is fun is just go through the demo without ever firing a gun.   Just catch the bullets that are being shot at you and throw them back at them.  Ha.. too much fun!

I think all shooter developers should look at Bullet Train and see how to get weapon handling just right. There is not much of a game here, as there is no challenge(you cannot die), but it is a stellar example of a VR shooter. And hey, it is free!
Man that was some epic matrix type business. Can't wait for this baby to come out of the oven. Totally epic
I can`t wait to see how the games are in a year if this is how it all begins :)
Intro to VR for those ready to jump in

review_title: Can't wait for the full game!
one_reviews_text:
This is by far the  most fun touch game I've tried so far. You can dual wield AKs, pull the pin and throw grenades.... and pluck bullets out of the air and send them back at the baddies!

Probably a good one for the unlucky people who experience motion sickness too, you move about with the increasingly popular "teleportion" method.

Did I forget to mention pump action shotguns!? Hell yes!

"This is to realistic!" My wife shouted when she took of the headset in the middle of the game. "It is way to scary if games get so real!"  I personally love this game and it shows how great the touch controllers work. You totally got the feeling your hands are present and you’re holding a gun. If this demo is so much fun, how about the full game? Big thank you to the developers!
Even if it's free, it's a boring wave shooter where you can only teleport (even worse : you can teleport only at a few predetermined places). Could have been a nice little FPS demo.

I use the teleport button extensively for the bullet time effect and it makes me feel like a boss lol.Robo Recall is going to be great but I would love to see Epic games release a game based on a combo of Bullet Train and Showdown that would be epic.

The game I was looking for when the Touch controllers arrived. Arizona zombie game is good and all, but the lack of smart save points is incredibly frustrating. This on the other hand is a short demo that piles on the satisfaction factor. When it ended, the words "That was @(*&^$ AWESOME!!" was heard down the block. Hoping Robo Recall won't be an exercise in insanely frustrating gameplay that Damaged Core turned out to be.

review_title: Exceptional showcase of a VR shooter
one_reviews_text: This demo is really quite something, and promises great things for the upcoming game , "Robo Recall", which was funded after this demo was released. 5 stars. You should play this.
I show this to all my friends as their first VR experience and they all end up shaking and sweaty - really cool demo, cant wait for RoboRecall.
best game ever!!!!
More games need to be made like this. Felt like an action hero.
Can´t wait until there are full titles like this available. Great demo!
This is the type of game you just have to show people if they've never tried VR before. I can't wait for Robo Recall!
Amazing.
As a demo of the future of VR and in particular FPS this is very impressive, the feedback of the shooting is excellent and overall a brilliant demo - want more, roll on Robo Recall!!
cool game
Its so fun ive played it multiple times and cant stop!
its note work, only black screen =(
Great demo

The gameplay and graphical fidelity are amazing for a demo. This is one that's great to show off to people because you play at your own pace.
i think this is a great game that helps users to get used to the oculus touch, would really like more though, maybe levels
One of the best VR experiences I've had to date. No sickness, no dizziness, great presence - instinctively took a knee to hide from bullets. Can't wait for Robo Recall.
Free and amazing for the first touch expierince! Try it its worth it!
awesome game dude sick

The gunplay in this demo is probably the best in VR at the moment. It just feels satisfying and "weighty". The AI is non-existant, but it's a fun little playground to show of for first-timers. Can't wait for Robo Recall.

I am a lifelong FPS fan and this is a dream come true. Actually playing an FPS instead of sitting and playing with a keyboard or controller. I wish this was a full game but I look forward to the game anounced at the end of the demo.

This is a really impressive short demo. It feels like you are neo in the matrix fighting off the enemy. Really well done and is the second demo I give out to people for the touch, right after first contact.

Gutted as played on a friends PC and it worked fine and looked fantastic, all my other oculus games work fine....any help? ;p
Game crashes in what looks like cinema mode in headset, white screen with two overlapped views fom each eye?
I'm rating this as a demo which is exactly what this is. Perfect to show those new to the Touch. I wish it was just a bit longer, but again, as a demo it is extremely well done :-)
The game runs great and was a fun play. It's a little short but its also free.

review_title: nothing but sound and hsowing on monitor
one_reviews_text: anyone have any idea how i can get this to work? gtx1080 and i7-6700
Fantastic gameplay, hope to see more!

For free, this is a fine demo, but it's over in about five minutes.  It definitely shows the promise of Oculus VR with Touch controllers, but for now this is like a tiny taste of something better to come later.
A short demo showing off VR gunplay.  It's not the best shooting game out there in VR, but where else can to snag bullets from mid air and throw them back at your enemies?
all around, a great and well put together game
It's a nice little demo, but it's only 5-10 minutes long. It shows off potential for first person shooters as a genre in VR though.
Even though it's just a tech demo, it's among the best experiences availible with Touch support so far. Better quality and more fun than the pre-packaged garbage included with the Touch at launch.
This was one of the first things i did with the touch and boy was i impressed. Everything feels natural when done in the game. This demo shows great potential for the touch future.
Unfortunately this also does not work for me at all. It renders on my screen, but not on my  oculus.. win 10 64bit 1080 nvidia, 4790k, 16gb
This experience is awesome.  The one complaint is I wish it was longer, because when it left me wanting more.  Definetaly recommended.
lol
So this is what it feels like to be jacked into the Matrix! Amazing tech demo that ends all too soon! Great tech demo for Oculus Rift and Touch. Download it ASAP!
Scr*w real life, I am staying in here!

It's a nice demo for the game.
It was fun playing but very easy to beat the enemies.
thank you Epic and Oculus for releasing this for free it is a great way to show people how powerful VR can make you feel
You will end up playing this more than Serious Sam. I want this to be a game, like a full game so much!
Looking forward to RoboRecall
If you get touch, play this game first. its not descirbable how awesome this is. after years of gaming this actually blew my mind like its had rarely been
fast pace fun, clear out your gaurdian zone good. You will be tripping over stuff
I cant remember if i payed for it, but bare in mind. It lasts like 5-10 mins and thats it. Can't wait for the next game it teased at.  Its basically the matrix. Awesome.
The first shooter I've tried, and I'm super impressed. Perfect to demo shooters to your friends. Can't wait for Robo Recall.
Better than most full games, I wish you could play it on a loop.   Can't wait for the full verison.

this is truely the best game ive tried so far.

i cant wait for the full game being release in 2017!

review_title: First Game to make me get so excited
one_reviews_text: I loved it was so ancy when the demo ended I wanted more so BAD when u duel wield the pistols and slow mo the bullets it felt like the matrix!
VR struggles with movement, this game finds a creative way around that, while making the shooting mechanics feel exactly as they should.....natural
Wish it was longer play
This is an awesome "teaser game" for the developers next game.  It lasts about 10 minutes or so depending on skill level.  Can't wait for the full game.
This was a great example of what is to come. Very short, but also good to demo to friends.
If you've always wanted to be like Neo in the Matrix, this is pretty close.  Amazing graphics and very satisfying.
I want more! Very cool game! Can't wait for the full game!!! A must have!
OMG!!!! This is insane.... I am so excited for the full version to come out and to the future of "proper" games in VR
It's a great demo, will be my #1 choice when showing people Touch. Robo Recall is gonna be great, thanks Epic Games!

This is one of the showcase touch games to try. Good example of a shooter in VR. Gameplay is simple and easy but the experience is worthy.

A fun demo of what Robo Recall will handle. Can't wait! BTW throwing back the bullets is so much fun!
The enemies seem to be on rails let alone the train, the weapons are fidly to use. GFX are blurry but the textures are realistic.
